LanguageAndText

Interface ITextFacade

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TextFacade

    public interface ITextFacade
    This interface represents a facade of the LanguageAndText package for accessing the property values.

    TODO: further comments

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static ITextFacade getInstance()
        Returns a Text-Facade-Object, which implements this interface. The pattern SINGLETON is used, so that only one TextFacade exists and the text is loaded once.
        Returns:
        Instance of a TextFacade (singleton)

      • setLocalisation

        boolean setLocalisation(java.util.Locale newLocalisation)
        This method is used to set a new localisation (language and country). If the localisation could be set to the new one (given in parameter newLocalisation), this method returns true. Otherwise the return value is false. A possible reason for this are missing files or wrong localisation.
        Parameters:
        newLocalisation - localisation, to which it should be set.
        Returns:
        If the localisation is successfully set, this return value is true. Otherwise it´s false.

      • setLocalisation

        boolean setLocalisation(java.lang.String language,
                        java.lang.String country)
        This method is similar to setLocalisation(Locale newLocalisation), but takes as parameters the language and country as string. These are converted to a Locale-object and calls setLocalisation(Locale newLocalisation) taking this object as input.
        Parameters:
        language - The new language to which it should be set.
        country - The new country to which it should be set.
        Returns:
        If the localisation is successfully set, this return value is true. Otherwise it´s false.
        See Also:
        setLocalisation(Locale newLocalisation)

      • getButtonText

        java.lang.String getButtonText(java.lang.String buttonName)
        Returns the text defined for the parameter buttonName in the button-properties file.
        Parameters:
        buttonName - Property name for which the value is returned.
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name
        See Also:
        TextNameConstants

      • getButtonText

        java.lang.String getButtonText(ViewActions action)
        This method is similar to getButtonText(String), but converts the given ViewActions to a string. This string serves as the parameter looking for in the button-properties file. Usually used for buttons which take standard names for their action.
        Parameters:
        action - Action for which the property should be return
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given action
        See Also:
        getButtonText(String), ViewActions

      • getDialogText

        java.lang.String getDialogText(java.lang.String dialogName)
        Returns the text defined for the parameter dialogName in the dialog-properties file. Used for the description messages in Dialogs like IErrorDialog and IWarningDialog.
        Parameters:
        dialogName - Property name for which the value is returned
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name
        See Also:
        TextNameConstants, IErrorDialog, IWarningDialog

      • getDialogText

        java.lang.String getDialogText(java.lang.String dialogName,
                               java.lang.String[] placeholderReplacer)
        In addition to getDialogText(String) the returned string is examined for placeholders like {PLACEHOLDER0} and replaces them with the given ones in placeholderReplacer. The number behind the placeholder-tag defines the index in the array.
        Parameters:
        dialogName - Property name for which the value is returned
        placeholderReplacer - Array of strings with which the placeholder should be replaced. The index specifies the concrete placeholder {PLACEHOLDERINDEX}.
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name with replaced placeholders
        See Also:
        getDialogText(String)

      • getParameterText

        java.lang.String getParameterText(java.lang.String parameterName)
        Returns the text defined for the parameter parameterName in the parameter-properties file. Used for the description of text fields in formula views like IFRequirementEditView.
        Parameters:
        parameterName - Property name for which the value is returned
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name
        See Also:
        TextNameConstants

      • getTitleText

        java.lang.String getTitleText(java.lang.String titleName)
        Returns the text defined for the parameter titleName in the title-properties file. Used for the titles in all kind of IView.
        Parameters:
        titleName - Property name for which the value is returned
        Returns:
        String saved in the property file for the given name
        See Also:
        TextNameConstants

      • convertStringToNumber

        java.lang.Number convertStringToNumber(java.lang.String stringToParse)
        Converts a string to a number within a specific Locale. The given string parameter will be parsed to a Number object from which the client can get different types of numbers (int, double, float etc.). While doing this the current location is taken into account which was set by setLocalisation(Locale). This is done to deal with e.g. double values independently of a language (european: "5,2" english: "5.2").
        Parameters:
        stringToParse - String which should be parsed
        Returns:
        The parsed Number object. If it could not be parsed a null value will be returned.

      • convertDoubleToString

        java.lang.String convertDoubleToString(double doubleToParse)
        Converts a double to a string within a specific Locale. The given double value will be converted taking the current location in account. This method is the counterpart to convertStringToNumber(String) and similar to convertIntegerToString(int).
        Parameters:
        doubleToParse - Double value which should be converted to string
        Returns:
        String converted from given double

      • convertIntegerToString

        java.lang.String convertIntegerToString(int integerToParse)
        Converts an integer to a string within a specific Locale. The given integer value will be converted taking the current location in account. This method is the counterpart to convertStringToNumber(String) and similar to convertDoubleToString(double).
        Parameters:
        integerToParse - Integer value which should be converted to string
        Returns:
        String converted from given integer
